title: Emily Ratajkowski And Ashley Graham Coordinate In Autumnal Hues For Adorable Catch Up
text:
From ELLE

Little did we know that Emily Ratajkowski and Ashley Graham have the model friendship we all needed to see this weekend.

On Friday, the 28-year-old model caught up with Graham in New York at her Inamorata offices for an impromptu photoshoot.

For the occasion, the model was spotted wearing an orange-coloured ribbed mini ‘Figueroa’ dress by her clothing brand, snakeskin knee-high boots and a Black and Brown ‘Harlow’ belt.

Meanwhile, Graham – who announced that she is pregnant with her first child with husband Justin Ervin last month – was seen wearing a burgundy-hued midi dress with a knotted bustier tie.

The pair – who were in New York City following the Big Apple’s fashion week this month – later shared images of their meet up and couldn’t help but gush about each other.

‘I tried real hard to keep my cool when @ashleygraham, her beautiful bump and me were all hanging in @inamoratawoman today but I got a little too excited,’ Ratajkowski captioned a series of photos of the pair.

Photo credit: Gotham - Getty Images More

In one snap, the pair show off their model prowess and in another, the model-turned-designer can be seen kneeling down and cradling Graham’s baby bump, much to the 31-year-old’s glee.

‘Love you ohh so much! [sic]’ the mum-to-be commented on Ratajkowski’s snap.

‘Cuteness overload,’ added model Lily Aldridge.

Ervin added: ‘Aww! Lol.’

Last month, Graham was praised by fans for sharing a candid image of herself in which she celebrated her stretch marks and expanding waistline.

'Same same but a little different,' the model captioned the powerful image, which has since received over 1.3 million likes.

One of the model’s followers commented on the picture: ‘I CANNOT WAIT for you to be a mother and teach another human being that ALL bodies are beautiful. You're going to be such an amazing mother. [sic]’

‘They aren't stretch marks, those are LIGHTING BOLTS OF FABULOUSNESS!!! [sic]’ another commented.
